com.web.webserver.http

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.web.webserver.http.HttpResponse
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmptyHttpResponse, FileHttpResponse, RawHttpRequest, StreamHttpResponse

    public abstract class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    HTTP Response abstract class used in communication with the client. This class contains the data that will be sent to the client, including status line, headers, and response body.

    • Field Detail

      • protocol

        protected java.lang.String protocol
        The String that represents the protocol version, used in the status line (e. g. HTTP/1.1).

      • statusCode

        protected int statusCode
        The status code element is a 3-digit int result code of the attempt to understand and satisfy the request. There are 5 classes of responses: 1xx: Informational - Request received, continuing process 2xx: Success - The action was successfully received, understood, and accepted 3xx: Redirection - Further action must be taken in order to complete the request 4xx: Client Error - The request contains bad syntax or cannot be fulfilled 5xx: Server Error - The server failed to fulfill an apparently valid request
        See Also:
        for available status codes

      • headers

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers
        The HashMap that contains the headers sent along with the response. The headers allow the server to pass additional information about the response which cannot be placed in the status line. These header fields give information about the server and about further access to the resource identified by the request URI.
